lead_paragraph: Because of an editing error, an article on Wednesday about the Australian Open tennis tournament misstated, in one instance and in some editions, the surname of the player who lost to Roger Federer in the quarterfinals. He is Juan Martín del Potro — not Dokic, which is the surname of a player in the women’s draw named Jelena who was mentioned elsewhere in the article. (She, too, lost her match.).
